intro: Isopyrum microphyllum, commonly known as the small-leaved sandwort, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the northern regions of North America. It belongs to the family Montiaceae and is characterized by its low-growing, mat-forming structure. The plant features small, elliptical leaves that are typically less than 1 centimeter in length, arranged in a dense rosette. Its flowers are tiny, white or pale green, and appear in clusters during the summer months. Isopyrum microphyllum thrives in sandy or gravelly soils and is often found in open, sun-exposed habitats.
